intro: Dontostemon intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate starflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other familiar species like willowherb and evening primrose. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or wetlands.
